New Records: The Padres became the first team in MLB postseason history to get six consecutive hits and hit for the cycle in the same inning.
Key Match Events: Kyle Higashioka hit a game-tying, solo home run to left-center with two outs in the bottom of the second
Luis Arraez, Fernando Tatis Jr. and Jurickson Profar loaded the bases with three consecutive singles
Manny Machado cashed in on those baserunners with a two-RBI double
Jackson Merrill cleared the bases with a two-RBI triple
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres swept the Braves out of the postseason thanks to a historic rally, advancing to an NLDS matchup with the Los Angeles Dodgers in the process.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves gave Max Fried the hook after the disastrous second inning, citing a hip injury he suffered on a comebacker from Tatis in the first
Atlanta's offense was only able to scrape up one run in the fifth, leaving them down 5-2 entering the eighth
Michael Harris II's two-run shot that inning cut the gap to one, but the comeback ended there
Others: The Padres will face off against the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 of the NLDS on Saturday at 8:30 p.m. ET
